tier.item: (22) Early 17th-century French (Maupas (1607), cited in Brunot (1905, III:477),
a. J'ay receu les lettres que m'avez envoyees
I've received the letters that me-have.2pl sent
"I've received the letters you sent me."

tier.item: i. V deletes before V-initial verb (Badiot):
ùn tut pert a chësc concurs
have (1pl) taken part to this competition
"We have taken part in this competition."

tier.item: iii. The three-syllable rule (no antepenultimate stress on verb):
ci podésson-Ø pa fa por os?
what could-1pl then do for you?
"What could we do for you, then?"

a. Si en orent -- moult grant merveille
Thus of-it had-3pl very great marvel (Merlin, 1)
"So they wondered very greatly at it."

b. Ainsi s'acorderent -- que il prendront par nuit.
Thus they-agreed that they will-take by night
